channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2023110446
item.description:
Report E-2023110446

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 25-pound pail of UN2880 was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer to the extent practicable. The damaged pail of calcium hypochlorite and all the released product was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly vented drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110161
item.description:
Report E-2023110161

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN3265 was punctured by a faulty skid and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged 30-gallon drum in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew deployed soda ash to the released material and swept them in using hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: FOUND IN UNLOAD. PLACED ENTIRE PACKAGE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE WITHIN A PLASTIC DRUM. DescribePack: BOX WAS WET WHEN RETRIEVED. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION A BOTTLE OF DRAIN OPENER HAD A LOOSE CAP AND WAS EMPTY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR PROPER DISPOSAL PROCEDURE.

item.title: Report X-2023101435
item.description:
Report X-2023101435

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The manager called it out on the radio a leaking hazmat and that there was a strong odor in the trailer. One of the admins grabbed all the hazmat totes and PPE and went over to check out the damaged hazmat. Discovered three hazmat were on its side in the trailer by station 282. All three of them were not upright by the orientation arrows. They were placed into a red hazardous waste totes and brought over to QA. DescribePack: The caps are vented and since they were found on its side and not upright. It leaked out slowly through the vented cap. DurationRel: 48 and MitigateEffect: put all the bottles upright to prevent from leaking.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was dropped by a package handler & the package had leaked & was brought to qa for inspection DescribePack: loose cap because the package was dropped by a package handler while being unloaded off a van DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: was placed in a hazmat tote & was brought to the Qa cage for processing

item.title: Report X-2023101398
item.description:
Report X-2023101398

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being loaded and package handler felt that out fiberboard box was damp. Alerted QA and they inspected package, found that closure was loose & leaking. Taken to HaZMat cage for reports and further inspection. Placed in red salvage tub. DescribePack: Spray bottle with hose for pouring began to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in plastic lined, red salvage tub. DPR entered, ISP report done, and Hess incident report being entered.

item.title: Report X-2023101389
item.description:
Report X-2023101389

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of decon labs denature ethanol 190 proof 1 bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallon to release from bottle package had no slotted partitions, bags or absorbent facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 1 gallon bottle of decon labs denatured ethanol 190 proof had a loose cap allowing .25 gallon to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 4 liter plastic bottles of color wright wright stain three 4 liter plastic bottles were cracked and leaking along the seams of the bottles allowing 1 liter from each plastic bottle to release package did have a cardboard liner on top with slotted partitions no bags or absorbent was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: Three 4 liter plastic bottles were cracked and leaking along the seams of the bottles allowing 1 liter from each bottle to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was removed from system flow and received in QA in a red hazardous materials bin. Upon inspection it was discovered that all 4 x 1 gallon cans of Isopropanol had loose caps causing them all to leak. due to them leaking, they damaged all 4 x 1 gallon cans. DescribePack: 4 x 1 gallon cans of isopropanol had a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a designated red hazardous materials bin

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON THE IR1 IRREG BELT, THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE PACKAGE SINCE THE PACKAGE WAS WET. THE RESPONDER INSPECTED THE PACKAGE AND FOUND THAT PART WAS LEAKING. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AND SEALED THE LEAK. THE RESPONDER THEN STARTED THE PROCESS THROUGH THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023101201
item.description:
Report X-2023101201

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DOOR 24 IN THE UNLOAD. WEARING PROPER PPE, RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID. NO LIQUID ON FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023101061
item.description:
Report X-2023101061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton ripped torn wet and leaking package found in trailer #451702 already damaged ripped torn wet and leaking. upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of automatic warewashing detergent 2 1 gallon plastic bottles had loose caps causing leakage and allowing .25 gallons to release. no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. package handler Thomas coulson was injured while attempting to pick up the box not knowing or seeing that the box was wet and leaking the liquid only got onto his hands he was attended to right away DescribePack: 2 out of 4 1 gallon plastic bottles had loose caps allowing .25 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat lined tote
